beantype.name: org.rapidbeans.rapidenv.config.Installunit
beantype.description: An installation unit is an installable and configurable unit needed for your development environment e. g the execution platform like JDK, a build tool like Ant, or an IDE like Eclipse.

property.name: fullyQualifiedName
property.description: The key property depends from name and space.

property.name: space
property.description: The installation unit name space. Works like a package in Java.

property.name: name
property.description: The installation unit name.

property.name: version
property.description: The version that is or should be installed.

property.name: depends
property.description: Defines the n to n dependency assocition between installation units. Installation of units that depend from other units (depends not null or empty) requires the installation of these units before (this holds for transitive dependencies too). If you install such a unit depending on other ones selectively the required units will be automatically be installed before. If you install all units RapidEnv will choose an appropriate installation sequence. If you deinstall a unit that is required by other ones selectively all other units directly or indirectly requiering this unit will be automatically deinstalled before (after user confirmation).

property.name: sourcetype
property.description: Defines how to get access to the installation source.

property.name: sourceurl
property.description: Defines where the installation source comes from. If "sourceurl" is not defined it automatically defaults to project.installsourceurl/space/name/version whereas each component of "space" will become a separate subfolder.

property.name: sourcefile
property.description: Specifies the source file name in case it is not the default one "<install unit name>-<version>.zip". Usually it is sufficient to define either a source file name or a complete source URL. Complex source URLs on the other hand sometimes make it hard or impossible to figure out the source file name. In this case you simply specify the source file name additionally.

property.name: downloadmode
property.description: Describes how to load the installation unit's file(s) (installer).

property.name: homedir
property.description: The folder where the unit is installed on your machine. If "homedir" is not defined it automatically defaults to project.installtargetdir/space/name/version whereas each component of "space" will become a separate subfolder.

property.name: osfamily
property.description: If this value is defined the install unit will exclusievely be installed on this type of operating system otherwise it will be installed operating system independently.

property.name: installcontrol
property.description: Determines if to install or deinstall the installation unit. normal: install and update as usual optional: install only when explicitely specified in the installation or update command. Update as usual discontinued: deinstall during update, refuse instsllstion snd configuration

property.name: installmode
property.description: Determines how to install the installation unit.

property.name: packaging
property.description: Determines the type of packaging.

property.name: removerootdirs
property.description: This flag drives the removal of one or more (single) root directories after having unpacked the installation zip file under "homedir". While "homedir" is usually sufficient the default behavior is removerootdirs="true".

property.name: deinstallunusedmode
property.description: Determines if or if not to deinstall unused version(s) after upgrade. Per default unused version(s) will always be deinstalled.

property.name: dependents
property.description: Defines the inverse part of the n to n dependency assocition between installation units. Installation of units ww other units (dependents not null or empty) is required before you install dependents (this holds for transitive dependencies too).

property.name: propertys
property.description: Installation unit specific property definitions.

property.name: downloads
property.description: URLs where to download the installation source

property.name: sourcefilechecks
property.description: Checks on the source file

property.name: subunits
property.description: Subunits if the installation unit. Subunits: - can not be installed specifically before their parent units are installed. - will be automatically installed when their parent units are installed. - will be automatically deinstalled when their parent units are deinstalled (no confirmation). - will be usually installed into the parent units installtion location. f you install all units RapidEnv will choose an appropriate installation sequence.

property.name: configurations
property.description: Configurations serve to configure an installation unit in distinct phases.

property.name: installcommand
property.description: Only valid for and mandatory for install units of mode "execute"

property.name: deinstallcommand
property.description: Only valid for and mandatory for install units of mode "execute"

property.name: propextensions
property.description: Defines a path extension defintion coming from this install unit. The extension will lead to some migration of the property value during upgrade if it changes.
